meanings.definition: To take away or diminish from
meanings.sent1: The loud noise detracted from my focus on the book.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather detracted from the beauty of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel detracted the attention of the children during the picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her constant complaints detracted from the positivity in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights detracted from the peaceful atmosphere of the evening.

meanings.definition: To reduce the value or importance of
meanings.sent1: His rude behavior detracted from his overall likability.
meanings.sent2: The scratch on the car detracted from its resale value.
meanings.sent3: The small stain on the shirt detracted from its brand new look.
meanings.sent4: The error in the report detracted from its credibility.
meanings.sent5: The missing piece detracted from the completeness of the puzzle.

meanings.definition: To divert or distract attention from
meanings.sent1: The magician used a trick to detract the audience's focus from his sleight of hand.
meanings.sent2: The bright colors of the painting detracted from the simplicity of the room.
meanings.sent3: The sudden noise detracted the dog's attention from the squirrel in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The interesting conversation detracted from the boring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The delicious smell of the bakery detracted from my diet plans.
